dialogue: I can’t let you out, Hedwig.
I’m not allowed to use magic outside of school.
I’m warning you, if you can’t control that bloody bird it’ll have to go.
If I could only let out for an hour or two
Huh, huh! So you could send secret messages to you freaky little friends. No, sir!
But I haven’t had any messages from any of my friends... not one… all summer.
Who’d want to be friends with you?
I should think you’d be a little more grateful.
We’ve raised you since you were a baby, given you the food off our table, even let you have Dudley’s second bedroom, purely out of the goodness of our hearts.
Not now, Pupkins. For when the Masons arrive.
Ahem...Now let’s go over our schedule once again, shall we?
Petunia when the Masons arrive you will be...?
in the lounge, waiting to welcome them graciously into our home.
Good! And- and Dudley, you will be...?
I’ll be waiting to open the door!
I’ll be in my bedroom, making no noise and pretending that I don’t exist.
With any luck, this could well be the day I make the biggest deal of my career.
And you will not mess it up!
Mr. and Mrs. Mason! Do come in!
Ha- ha- ha! Ha, ha! Ho, ho, ho! Ha, ha!
Harry Potter! Such an honor it is!
Dobby sir, Dobby the house elf.
Not to be to be rude or anything, but this isn’t a great time for me to have a house elf in my bedroom.
Oh, oh yes, sir! Dobby understands!
It’s just that, Dobby has come to tell you- it is difficult, sir
Oh, oh, ho. Oh, ho, ho... Oh, ho, ho.
I didn’t mean to offend you, or anything.
Dobby has heard of your greatness, sir, but never has he been asked to sit down by a wizard, like an equal.
You can’t have met many decent wizards then.
That was an awful thing to say.
Dobby had to punish himself, sir.
Dobby almost spoke ill of his family, sir.
The wizard family Dobby serves, sir.
Dobby is bound to serve one family forever.
If they ever knew Dobby was here...ooh...
Dobby has to protect Harry Potter- to warn him.
Harry Potter must not go back to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry this year!
There is a plot, a plot to make most terrible things happen.
Ok– I- understand. You can’t- say.
Don’t make me talk, I— Errr...
Dobby! Dobby, put the lamp down.
Give me the lamp! Dobby stop!
Get in there, and keep quiet!
What the devil are you doing up here?
You just ruined the punch line of my Japanese golfer joke!
One more sound, and you’ll wish you’d never been born, boy!
Yes, sir... See why I’ve got to go back?
I belong in your world, at Hogwarts.
It’s the only place I’ve got friends!
Friends who don’t even write to Harry Potter?
Well, I expect they’ve... been- hang on-
how do you know my friends haven’t been writing to me?
Harry Potter mustn’t be angry with Dobby.
Heh- Dobby hoped, if Harry Potter thought his friends had forgotten him, Harry Potter might not want to go back to school, sir.
Harry Potter must say he’s not going back to school!
I can’t. Hogwarts is my home!
Then, Dobby must do it, sir, for Harry Potter’s own good.
...it spread as far as the eye could see, all over the floor of this vast building, and it was this deep.
And one plumber said “Look at all that water.”
A-and the second plumber said, “Yes, and that’s just the top of it!”
I’m so sorry! It’s my nephew- he’s very disturbed.
That’s why I kept him upstairs!
You’re never going back to that school.
You’re never going to see those freaky friends of yours again. Never!
What are you all doing here?
Now, come on. Get your trunk!...
You’d better stand back. Let’s go!
Now, what the hell’s he doing? Potter!
Oh no, boy! You and that bloody pigeon aren’t going anywhere!
By the way, Harry, Happy Birthday!
Come on. Okay, come on. Shh!
Shh! Ok, come on. Shh! Come on.
Do you think it’d be all right if we had some of this?
It’s not much, but it’s home.
Harry, how wonderful to see you dear.
Beds empty! No note! Car gone!
You could have died! You could have been seen!
Of course, I don’t blame you, Harry dear.
There were bars on his window!
Well, you’d best hope that I don’t put bars on your window, Ron Weasleyald Weasley!
Come on Harry, time for a spot of breakfast.
Now tuck in! That’s it. There we go.
Mum- Mummy, have you seen my jumper?
Yes dear. It was on the cat.
Ginny. She’s been talking about you all summer.
What a night. Nine raids. Nine!
Dad works in the Ministry of Magic, in the Misuse of Muggle Artifacts Office.
Dad loves Muggles, thinks they’re fascinating.
Well now. Aah! And who are you?
Oh, sorry sir. I’m Harry, sir, Harry Potter.
Well, Ron Weasley’s told us all about you, of course.
This morning. Your sons flew that enchanted car of yours to Surrey and back last night.
Did you really? How’d it go? Did you—

character_name: FRED, GEORGE, Ron Weasley, Harry Potter

dialogue: I mean...that was very wRon Weasleyg, indeed, boys.
Now, Harry, you must know all about Muggles.
Tell me, what exactly is the function of a rubber duck?
Well, that’ll be Errol with the post.
Oh, fetch it will you Percy, please?
Oh look, it’s our Hogwarts letters.
And they’ve sent us Harry’s as well.
Dumbledore must know you’re here, Harry.
Doesn’t miss a trick, that man.
This lot won’t come cheap, Mum.
The spell books alone are very expensive.
There’s only one place we’re going to get all of this.
But Harry's never traveled by Floo powder before, Mum.
You go first, Ron Weasley, so that Harry can see how it's done. Yes.
You see? It's quite easy, dear.
Now, don't forget to speak very, very clearly.
Mr. Malfoy! What a pleasure to see you again.
If I may, just in today --
I'm not buying today, Mr. Borgin.
You have heard, of course, that the Ministry of Magic is conducting more raids.
There are even rumors of a new Muggle Protection Act...
I have a few... ah... items at home that might prove embarrassing if the Ministry were to call.
Insert a candle and it gives light only to the holder.
Best friend of thieves and plunderers.
Your son has fine taste, sir.
Hopefully my son will amount to more than a thief, Mr. Borgin.
Though if his marks don't pick up --
It's not my fault the teachers have favorites.
I would have thought you'd be ashamed that a girl of no wizarding family beat you in every exam.
Wizard blood is counting for less everywhere.
I'll expect you at the manor tomorrow.
Not lost, are you, my dear?
I'm fine, thank you. I was just going...
We'll help you find your way back.
What do you think you're doing down here? Come on.
Don't want no one to see you there.
People will think you're up to no good.
What were you doing down there then?
I was looking for Flesh-Eating Slug Repellent.
They're ruining all the school cabbages.
It's so good to see you.
It's great to see you too.
What did you do to your glasses?
I definitely need to remember that one.
You'll be all right now then, Harry?
Right. I'll leave you to it.
Come on, everyone's been so worried.
We'd hoped you'd only gone one grate too far.
Ladies and gentlemen, Mr. Gilderoy Lockhart.
Let me by, madam. Thank you.
This is for the Daily Prophet.
Together, you and I rate the fRon Weasleyt page.
Ladies and gentlemen, what an extraordinary moment this is.
When young Harry stepped into Flourish and Blotts this morning to purchase my autobiography, Magical Me…
which, incidentally, is currently celebrating its 27th week atop the Daily Prophet bestseller list
he had no idea that he would, in fact, be leaving with my entire collected works free of charge.
Harry, now you give me those, and I'll get them signed.
I'll bet you loved that, didn't you, Potter?
Can't go into a bookshop without making the fRon Weasleyt page.
Lucius Malfoy. We meet at last.
As, of course, is the wizard who gave it to you.
He was nothing more than a murderer.
You must be very brave to mention his name.
Fear of a name only increases fear of the thing itself.
And you must be Miss Granger.
Yes, Draco has told me all about you.
Red hair, vacant expressions tatty, secondhand book.
Busy time at the Ministry, Arthur, all those extra raids?
I do hope they're paying you overtime but judging by the state of this, I'd say not.
What's the use in being a disgrace to the name of wizard if they don't even pay you well for it?
We have a very different idea about what disgraces the name of wizard, Malfoy.
And I thought your family could sink no lower.
The train will be leaving any moment.
Oh dear! The train'll be leaving any moment!
Come on, Ginny, we'll get you a seat. Hurry.
What do you two think you're doing?
The gateway has sealed itself for some reason.
Harry, if we can't get through maybe Mum and Dad can't get back.
Maybe we should just go and wait by the car.
Ron Weasley, I should tell you most Muggles aren't accustomed to seeing a flying car.
Oh, no! The Invisibility Booster must be faulty.
Come on, then. Let's go lower.
We need to find the train.
All we need to do is catch up with the train.
I'm trying. Your hand's all sweaty.
I think we found the train.
Up! Ron Weasley, mind that tree!
My wand. Look at my wand.
Be thankful it's not your neck.
So a house-elf shows up in my bedroom we can't get through the barrier to platform 93/4...
we almost get killed by a tree...
Clearly someone doesn't want me here this year.
Well, take a good look, lads.
This night might well be the last you spend in this castle.
Oh, dear, we are in trouble.
You were seen by no less than seven Muggles.
Do you have any idea how serious this is?
You have risked the exposure of our world.
Not to mention the damage you inflicted on a Whomping Willow.
that's been on these grounds since before you were born.
Honestly, Professor Snape, I think it did more damage to us.
I assure you that were you in Slytherin, and your fate rested with me...
the both of you would be on the train home tonight.
Headmaster these boys have flouted the Decree for the Restriction of Underage Wizardry.
I am well aware of our bylaws having written quite a few of them myself.
However, as head of Gryffindor house it is for Professor McGonagall to determine the appropriate action.
We'll go and get our stuff, then.
What are you talking about, Mr. Weasley?
You're going to expel us, aren't you?
Not today, Mr. Weasley but I must impress on both of you the seriousness of what you have done.
I will be writing to your families tonight, and you will both receive detention.
Welcome to Greenhouse Three, Second Years.
Today, we will be re-potting Mandrakes.
Now, who here can tell me the properties of the Mandrake?
Mandrake, or Mandragora is used to return those who have been Petrified to their original state.
The Mandrake's cry is fatal to anyone who hears it.
As our Mandrakes are still only seedlings their cries won't kill you yet.
But they could knock you out for hours, which is why I have given you earmuffs for auditory protection.
So could you please put them on, right away? Quickly.
Flaps tight down, and watch me closely.
You pull it sharply up out of the pot.
Got it? And now you dunk it down into the other pot
and pour a little sprinkling of soil to keep him warm.
Yes, well, just leave him there.
Plenty of pots to go around.
Grasp your Mandrake and pull it up.
I'm Colin Creevey. I'm in Gryffindor too.
Hi, Colin. Nice to meet you.
Ron Weasley, is that your owl?
I ignored one from my gran once.
HOW DARE YOU STEAL THAT CAR!
YOUR FATHER'S NOW FACING AN INQUIRY AT WORK AND IT'S ENTIRELY YOUR FAULT!
IF YOU PUT ANOTHER TOE OUT OF LINE WE'LL BRING YOU STRAIGHT HOME!
And, Ginny, dear, congratulations on making Gryffindor.
Your father and I are so proud.
Let me introduce you to your new Defense Against the Dark Arts Teacher.
Me. Gilderoy Lockhart, Order of Merlin, Third Class, Honorary Member of the Dark Force Defense League and five times winner of Witch Weekly's Most-Charming-Smile Award
But I don't talk about that.
I didn't get rid of the Bandon Banshee by smiling at her!
It is my job to arm you against the foulest creatures known to wizardkind.
You may find yourselves facing your worst fears in this room.
Know only that no harm can befall you whilst I am here.
I must ask you not to scream.
Laugh if you will, Mr. Finnegan but pixies can be devilishly tricky little blighters.
Let's see what you make of them.
Come on now, round them up, round them up!
I'll ask you three to just nip the rest of them back into their cage.
I spent the summer devising a whole new Quidditch program.
We're gonna train earlier, harder and longer.
Where you think you're going, Flint?
I booked the pitch for Gryffindor today.
Easy, Wood. I've got a note.
I, Professor Severus Snape, do hereby give the Slytherin team permission to practice today, owing to the need to train their new Seeker.
You've got a new Seeker. Who?
And that's not all that's new this year.
You see, Weasley, unlike some, my father can afford the best.
At least no one on the Gryffindor team had to buy their way in.
They got in on pure talent.
No one asked your opinion, you filthy little Mudblood.
You'll pay for that one, Malfoy.
Wow! Can you turn him around, Harry?
No, Colin, get out of the way.
This calls for a specialist's equipment.
Nothing to do but wait till it stops, I'm afraid.
Who was Ron Weasley trying to curse, anyway?
Well, I don't know exactly what it means.
Mudblood's a foul name for someone who's Muggle-born.
It's not a term one usually hears in civilized conversation.
See, the thing is, Harry, there are some wizards, like the Malfoy family...who think they're better than everyone else because they're pure-blood.
Why, there isn't a wizard alive today that's not half-blood or less.
More to the point, they've yet to think of a spell that our Hermione Granger can't do.
Don't you think on it, Hermione Granger.
Don't you think on it for one minute.
Can you possibly imagine a better way to serve detention than by helping me to answer my fan mail?
Fame is a fickle friend, Harry.
What are you talking about, Harry?
I think you're getting a bit drowsy.
We've been here nearly four hours.
Spooky how the time flies when one is having fun.
I heard it first in Lockhart's office.
I think it's going to kill.
I've never seen spiders act like that.

The Chamber of Secrets has been opened. 
Enemies of the Heir, beware.
Go on. Make way, make way.
Everyone will proceed to their dormitories immediately.
I know exactly the countercurse that could've spared her.
But how she has been Petrified, I cannot say.
You saw what he wrote on the wall.
It's not true, sir. I swear.
Perhaps Potter and his friends were just in the wRon Weasleyg place at the wRon Weasleyg time.
I, for one, don't recall seeing Potter at dinner.
I'm afraid that's my doing, Severus.
You see, Harry was helping me answer my fan mail.
That's why Ron Weasley and I went looking for him, professor.
We'd just found him when he said...
When I said I wasn't hungry.
We were heading back to the common room when we found Mrs. Norris.
I want to see some punishment!
We will be able to cure her, Argus.
As I understand it, Madam Sprout has a very healthy growth of Mandrake.
When matured, a potion will be made which will revive Mrs. Norris.
And in the meantime I stRon Weasleygly recommend caution to all.
It's a bit strange, isn't it?
You hear this voice, a voice only you can hear...
and then Mrs. Norris turns up Petrified. It's just strange.
Do you think I should have told them?
Dumbledore and the others, I mean?
No, Harry. Even in the wizarding world, hearing voices isn't a good sign.
Right. Now, today, we will be transforming animals into water goblets.
Who would like to go first?
That wand needs replacing, Mr. Weasley.
Professor I was wondering if you could tell us about the Chamber of Secrets.
You all know, of course that Hogwarts was founded over a thousand years ago by the four greatest witches and wizards of the age:
Now, three of the founders coexisted quite harmoniously.
Salazar Slytherin wished to be more selective about the students admitted to Hogwarts.
He believed magical learning should be kept within all-magic families.
Unable to sway the others, he decided to leave the school.
Now, according to legend Slytherin had built a hidden chamber in this castle known as the Chamber of Secrets.
Though, shortly before departing, he sealed it until that time when his own true Heir returned to the school.
The Heir alone would be able to open the Chamber and unleash the horror within, and by so doing purge the school of all those who in Slytherin's view, were unworthy to study magic.
Well , Naturally, the school has been searched many times.
No such chamber has been found.
Professor? What exactly does legend tell us lies within the Chamber?
The Chamber is said to be home to something that only the Heir of Slytherin can control.
It is said to be the home of a monster.
Do you think there really is a Chamber of Secrets?
If there really is a Chamber of Secrets, and it has been opened, that means...
The Heir of Slytherin has returned to Hogwarts.
The question is, who is it?
Who do we know who thinks all Muggle-borns are scum?
But Malfoy, the Heir of Slytherin?
Maybe Ron Weasley's right, Hermione Granger.
I mean, look at his family.
The whole lot of them have been in Slytherin for centuries.
Maybe we could trick them into telling.
But there might be another way.
Mind you, it would be difficult.
Not to mention we'd be breaking about 50 school rules...
Properly brewed, the Polyjuice Potion allows the drinker to transform himself temporarily into the physical form of another.
You mean if Harry and I drink that stuff, we'll turn into Crabbe and Goyle?
Wicked! Malfoy will tell us anything.
I've never seen a more complicated potion.
How long will it take to make?
if Malfoy is the Heir of Slytherin he could attack half the Muggle-borns in the school by then.
But it's the only plan we've got.
Blimey! Harry's got himself a rogue Bludger.
That's been tampered with, that has.
No! Even with a proper wand, it's too risky.
Harry Potter has caught the Snitch.
No. I think my arm is broken.
I will fix that arm of yours straight away.
Boy doesn't know what he's saying.
Yes, well, that can sometimes happen but the point is you can no longer feel any pain, and, very clearly, the bones are not broken.
Mr. Malfoy, stop making such a fuss.
You can go. Out of my way.
Should have been brought straight to me.
I can mend bones in a heartbeat, but growing them back...
You will be able to, won't you?
You're in for a rough night, Potter.
Regrowing bones is a nasty business.
Harry Potter should have listened to Dobby.
Harry Potter should have gone back home when he missed the train.
You stopped the barrier from letting Ron Weasley and me through.
You nearly got Ron Weasley and me expelled.
At least you would be away from here.
Dobby thought his Bludger would be enough to make Harry Potter see...
Your Bludger? You made that Bludger chase after me?
Dobby had to iRon Weasley his hands.
You better clear off before my bones come back Dobby, or I might strangle you.
Dobby is used to death threats, sir.
Dobby gets them five times a day at home.
I don't suppose you could tell me why you're trying to kill me?
Dobby remembers how it was before Harry Potter triumphed over He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named.
We house-elves were treated like vermin, sir.
Of course, Dobby is still treated like vermin.
Why do you wear that thing, Dobby?
This, sir? It is a mark of the house-elf's enslavement.
Dobby can only be freed if his master presents him with clothes.
Terrible things are about to happen at Hogwarts.
Harry Potter must not stay here...now that history is to repeat itself.
Repeat itself? You mean this has happened before?
Oahh! I shouldn't have said that.
Tell me Dobby when did this happen before?
Dobby only wants Harry Potter to be safe.
I think he's been Petrified, Madam Pomfrey.
Look. Perhaps he managed to take a picture of his attacker.
It means that our students are in great danger.
What should I tell the staff?
Tell them Hogwarts is no longer safe.
It is as we feared, Minerva
The Chamber of Secrets has indeed been opened again.
Again? You mean the Chamber of Secrets has been opened before?
Lucius Malfoy must have opened it when he was at school here.
Now he's taught Draco how to do it.
We'll have to wait for the Polyjuice Potion to know for sure.
Enlighten me. Why are we brewing this potion in broad daylight in the middle of the girls' lavatory?
Don't you think we'll get caught?
No. No one ever comes in here.
I wouldn't expect you to know me.
Who would ever talk about ugly, miserable moping Moaning Myrtle? Aaaaaa…
In light of the dark events of recent weeks Professor Dumbledore has granted me permission to start this Dueling Club to train you all up.
In case you ever need to defend yourselves as I myself have done on countless occasions.
For full details, see my published works.
Let me introduce my assistant Professor Snape.
He has sportingly agreed to help with a short demonstration.
I don't want any of you youngsters to worry.
You'll still have your Potions master when I'm through with him. Never fear.
Do you think he's all right?
An excellent idea to show them that, Professor Snape...
but if you don't mind me saying, it was obvious what you were about to do.
If I had wanted to stop you, it would have been only too easy.
Perhaps it would be prudent to first teach the students to block unfriendly spells, professor.
Weasley's wand causes devastation with the simplest spells.
We'll be sending Potter to the hospital wing in a matchbox.
Might I suggest someone from my own house?
On the count of three cast your charms to disarm your opponent. Only to disarm.
We don't want any accidents here.
I'll get rid of it for you.
I know. I accidentally set a python on my cousin Dudley at the zoo once.
I bet loads of people here can do it.
It's not a very common gift, Harry.
What's bad? If I hadn't told that snake not to attack Justin...
That's what you said to it.
You were there. You heard me.
How can I speak a language without knowing I can?
I don't know, but it sounded like you were egging the snake on or something.
There's a reason the symbol of Slytherin house is a serpent.
He could talk to snakes too.
Now the whole school's gonna think you're his great-great-great grandson.
He lived a thousand years ago.
For all we know, you could be.
I'll see you back in the common room.
I'll have you out this time, Potter.
No. Mr. Filch! You don't understand...
This is out of my hands, Potter.
Professor Dumbledore will be waiting for you.
I...I..I was just wondering if you put me in the right house.
Yes. You were particularly difficult to place.
But I stand by what I said last year.
You would have done well in Slytherin.
Your bird...There was nothing I could do.
He's been looking dreadful for days.
Pity you had to see him on a burning day.
They burst into flame when it is time for them to die...
and then they are reborn from the ashes.
They can carry immensely heavy loads.
Professor Dumbledore, sir, it wasn't Harry.
I'd be prepared to swear it in fRon Weasleyt of the Ministry of Magic.
I do not believe that Harry attacked anyone.
You don't think it was me, professor?
No, Harry. I do not think it was you.
But I must ask you is there something you wish to tell me?
We just need a bit of who you're changing into.
We also need to make sure that the real Crabbe and Goyle can't burst in on us while we're interrogating Malfoy.
I've got it all worked out.
I filled these with a simple Sleeping Draught.
Now, once they're asleep hide them in the broomstick cupboard and pull out a few of their hairs and put on their uniforms.
Whose hair are you ripping out, then?
I got this off her robes.
I'm going to go check on the Polyjuice Potion.
Make sure that Crabbe and Goyle find these.
Ron Weasley, maybe I should do it.
We'll have exactly one hour before we change back into ourselves.
I think I'm gonna be sick.
You need to sound more like Crabbe.
I think the Slytherin common room's this way.
I mean, what are you doing down here?
I happen to be a school prefect.
You, on the other hand, have no business wandering the corridors at night.
Crabbe, Goyle, where have you been?
Pigging out in the Great Hall all this time?
I didn't know you could read.
And what are you doing down here, Weasley?
You'd never know the Weasleys were pure-bloods, the way they behave.
They're an embarrassment to the wizarding world. All of them.
What's wRon Weasleyg with you, Crabbe?
I'm surprised the Daily Prophet hasn't done a report on all these attacks.
I suppose Dumbledore is trying to hush it all up.
Father always said Dumbledore was the worst thing that ever happened to this place.
You think there's someone here who's worse than Dumbledore?
And people actually think that he's the Heir of Slytherin?
But then you must have some idea who's behind it all.
How many times do I have to tell you?
But my father did say this:
It's been 50 years since the Chamber was opened.
He wouldn't tell me who opened it.
The last time the Chamber of Secrets was opened, a Mudblood died.
So it's only a matter of time before one of them is killed this time.
As for me I hope it's Granger.
What's the matter with you two?
We've got loads to tell you.
Wait till you see. It's awful.
Do you remember me telling you that the Polyjuice Potion was only for human transformations?
It was cat hair I plucked off Millicent Bulstrode's robes.
Have you spoken to Hermione Granger?
She should be out of hospital in a few days when she stops coughing up fur balls.
Looks like Moaning Myrtle's flooded the bathroom.
Ohh-Uhh..Come to throw something else at me?
Why would I throw something at you?
Don't ask me. Here I am, minding my own business and someone thinks it's funny to throw a book at me.
But it can't hurt if someone throws something at you.
I mean, it'll just go right through you.
SURE! Let's all throw books at Myrtle because she can't feel it.
Ten points if you get it through her stomach!
Fifty points if it goes through her head!
But who threw it at you, anyway?
I don't know. I didn't see them.
I was just sitting in the U-bend, thinking about death and it fell through the top of my head.
Hello Harry Potter, my name is Tom Riddle.
Do you know anything about the Chamber of Secrets?
No. But I can show you.
Let me take you back fifty years ago.
Could you tell me what's going on here?
It is not wise to be wandering around this late hour, Tom.
I had to see for myself if the rumors were true.
I don't have a home to go to.
They wouldn't really close Hogwarts, would they, professor?
I understand, Tom, but I'm afraid Headmaster Dippet may have no choice.
Sir, if it all stopped, if the person responsible was caught...
Is there something you wish to tell me?
Very well, then. Off you go.
Let's get you out of there.
I'm going to have to turn you in Hagrid
I don't think you meant it to kill anyone...
The dead girl's parents will be here tomorrow.
The least Hogwarts can do is make sure the thing that killed their daughter is slaughtered.
Aragog never killed no one. Never.
Monsters don't make good pets, Hagrid.
They'll have your wand for this, Hagrid.
Hagrid opened the Chamber of Secrets 50 years ago.
We don't even know this Tom Riddle.
He sounds like a dirty, rotten snitch.
The monster had killed somebody, Ron Weasley.
What would any of us have done?
